summary: Åse is a water expert and systems ecologist with 24 years’ professional experience with a diverse portfolio of empirical research, project and program management, knowledge brokering and policy work at Swedish, European, African and international level. Her main areas of expertise are learning and collaboration for adaptive governance, and resilience building in water. This includes risk reduction and adaptation in integrated water resources management, nature based solutions, urban water services and integrated planning and management in various ecosystems and urban areas.

profile_positions.description:
Deltares is an independent institute for applied water research. I will be working on policy and governance for climate adaptation and resilience at an international level.

My current roles are:

Team lead on the IPDC report for The International Panel on Deltas and Coastal areas (IPDC) 
 
Senior researcher on financing of Nature based Solutions in the European research project REST-COAST - Large scale RESToration of COASTal ecosystems through rivers to sea connectivity

Developing training for The Green Climate Fund (GCF) adaptation project concept note development.

Developing a proposal on drought and NbS for European research
profile_positions.title: Senior Researcher/Advisor

profile_positions.description:
Project manager and researcher in the project WASH & RESCUE - WAter, Sanitation and Hygiene in RESilient Cities and Urban areas adapting to Extreme waters - Preventing risk to human health and security taking a holistic, environmental and socio-economic approach. 

Researcher in projects:

EDUCEN Culture and DRR H2020 

Supported the Work Package on adaptive governance in the FP7 project RISC-KIT Resilience-Increasing Strategies for Coasts - toolKIT led by Deltares. www.risckit.eu 

Supported UNDRR to evaluate their Local Government Self assessments (Resilient city campaign) and how it stimulated local action in DRR and urban resilience.

Baltic COMPASS project: Ase wrote a report and published a paper on policy adaptation and governance in the nexus of flood and nutrient management. 

Contributed to a study on gender and the implications of climate change, disaster risk reduction for the Swedish Civil Contingency Agency.
profile_positions.title: Researcher, Project Manager

profile_positions.description:
Support to the African Adaptation Acceleration Program (AAAP) including the City Adaptation Accelerator (CCA) and the Bangladesh program to upscale water adaptation in cities and catchments.  This included liaison with the African Development Bank and involved Governments, developing ToR, procuring consultants/firms, and developing design of adaptation projects focusing on the use of Nature-based Solutions (NbS). 

Developed the program concept, strategy and plan for the global program Water Adaptation Communities (WAC) including design of suitable engagement models to capture good practice and insights from practitioners and experts through webinars, dialogues, focus group discussions and global knowledge exchanges.

Developed a framework for mainstreaming of water adaptation for the WAC web platform, cross-cutting with hotspots for adaptation (urban, deltas etc). Translating practitioner and expert knowledge to policy makers, identified gaps to research, and brokering good practice worldwide. 

Developed and managed the web platform https://communities.adaptationexchange.org/  This was done in collaboration with service provider SEI Oxford as a microsite to www.weAdapt.org
profile_positions.title: Senior Program Officer

company.name: The Faculty of Engineering at Lund University, LTH

profile_positions.company: The Faculty of Engineering at Lund University
profile_positions.description: This research aimed at investigate adaptive capacity and transformative governance by comparing flood risk governance in Netherlands and Sweden.
profile_positions.title: Postdoctoral Fellow

profile_positions.description: The Water and Disaster Risk Reduction Cluster group at the Swedish Water House / SIWI was a group consisting of representatives from about 20 Swedish organisations. The overall aim was to facilitate the adoption and implementation of emerging issues within the policy arena of Water and DRR. The group contributed amongst many things to the UNDRR campaign 'Resilient Cities' and produced a policy brief to policy makers at the Swedish Foreign Ministry.
profile_positions.title: Lead, cluster group on Water and Disaster Risk Reduction

profile_positions.description:
Consultancy in water and natural resource management

Consultant in the Baltic Compass project. Contributing to case study documentation of governance system for sustainable agriculture in flooded environments. Seminar conceptualization, planning and organization for sharing practical and scientific knowledge to advice policy and financial decision making.

Consultant for the SPLASH project in Maputo, Mozambique in resilient and sustainable sanitation service chains coordinated by IWA.
profile_positions.title: Director

profile_positions.description:
Co-lead (until 2010 lead) on the working group 8 on sanitation in emergencies and reconstruction situations and creating and managing the group blog http://susanawg8.wordpress.com/ 

Contributed to the Stoutenburg process including several workshops with emergency and sanitation experts in Feb 2009 and Feb 2011, took the lead in drafting a successful proposal for the consortium (Action Contre la Faim, Oxfam GB and WASTE).

Drafted the sanitation component in a successful proposal: S(p)eedkits - a 3 year EU research project (FP7) with multiple partners for emergency shelters incl MSF and Red Cross

Drafted proposal to Gates innovation challenge in adaptive sanitation solution for difficult environments and development context.

Collected case studies of alternative and sustainable sanitation in emergencies and summarized findings (poster at World Water Week 2010).
profile_positions.title: Lead & Co-lead for the working group for sustainable sanitation in emergencies and reconstruction

profile_positions.description:
The Development Programme focused on the needs for water services in urban areas in low and middle income countries.

Ase mainly worked with: 

Developing the Disaster risk management program (focusing on governance of urban sanitation, and sustainable resource management) and the Climate Change program

She also developed/contributed to: World Water Monitoring Day www.wwmd.org, the Access to water & sanitation task force, Women in Water program, Cities of the Future program, Expertise exchange program
profile_positions.title: Development Programme Coordinator

profile_positions.description:
Integrated Water Resources Management for the Okavango Delta Management Plan in Botswana. This was part of the IUCN's WANI - Water and Nature Initiative. 

Technical support to IUCNs regional programmatic work in Southern Africa.
profile_positions.title: Associate Expert

profile_positions.description:
Supported the FP 7 HarmoniCOP project (on social learning for water management in river basins)

Developed SKEP for the European Environment Agency (classification system for European research)

Contributed to the (UK) Environment Agency’s communication strategy for river basin management.
profile_positions.title: Consultant
